intro: Pelea manukaensis, commonly known as the Manuka pelea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pelea manukaensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas.
